chinese: [C] a person who makes money by starting or running businesses, esp. when this involves taking financial risks 企业家
examples: e.g. He would not have succeeded in such a risky business if he had not been such a clever [[entrepreneur]].

chinese: wrong in one's opinion or judgment 意见（或判断）错误的，弄错的
examples: e.g. She wondered whether she'd been [[mistaken]] about his intentions.

chinese: wrongly or by mistake 错误地；曲解地；被误解地
examples: e.g. This app will help you get a photo or document back if you [[mistakenly]] delete it.

chinese: [C] 虫洞（宇宙中可能存在的连接遥远空间的通道）
1) if buildings sprawl, they spread out over a wide area in an untidy and unattractive way （建筑群）杂乱地延伸（扩展）
examples: e.g. The town [[sprawls]] along the side of the lake.；e.g. He was [[sprawling]] on the sofa watching his favorite TV program.

chinese: 2) lie or sit with your arms or legs stretched out in a lazy or careless way （懒洋洋地或漫不经心地）摊开手脚躺（坐）着
examples: e.g. The town [[sprawls]] along the side of the lake.；e.g. He was [[sprawling]] on the sofa watching his favorite TV program.

chinese: walk slowly across or around an area, usu. without a clear direction or purpose 徘徊；闲逛；漫步于
examples: e.g. She was [[wandering]] aimlessly up and down the road.

chinese: [C] a table or small shop with an open front that people sell things from, esp. at a market （尤指集市上的）货摊，摊位，售货亭
examples: e.g. The street is lined with [[stalls]] selling Chinese New Year decorations.

chinese: [C] (pl. spectra) a complete range of opinions, people, situations, etc., going from one extreme to its opposite （观点、人、情况等的）范围，幅度
examples: e.g. A balanced diet should contain a broad [[spectrum]] of plant and animal foods.

chinese: 1) an electrical wire or wires with a protective covering, usu. for connecting electrical equipment to the supply of electricity 电线
examples: e.g. We used so many lights that we needed four extension [[cords]].；e.g. Have you got some [[cord]] that I can tie this parcel up with?

chinese: 2) a piece of thick string or thin rope 粗线；细绳；索；带
examples: e.g. We used so many lights that we needed four extension [[cords]].；e.g. Have you got some [[cord]] that I can tie this parcel up with?

chinese: put all the parts of sth. together 组装；装配
examples: e.g. The shelves are sold in kits that you have to [[assemble]] yourself.；e.g. Since she took over the department, she has [[assembled]] a talented team with a varied selection of skills.

chinese: if you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose 集合；聚集
examples: e.g. The shelves are sold in kits that you have to [[assemble]] yourself.；e.g. Since she took over the department, she has [[assembled]] a talented team with a varied selection of skills.

chinese: 1) (literary) among or surrounded by things 在···之中；被···所环绕
examples: e.g. We camped in a shallow valley [[amid]] low hills covered with green pine trees.；e.g. The dollar has fallen in value [[amid]] rumors of weakness in the US economy.

chinese: 2) while noisy, busy, or confused events are happening — used in writing or news reports 在（嘈杂、纷乱的事件）中（用于书面语或新闻报道中）
examples: e.g. We camped in a shallow valley [[amid]] low hills covered with green pine trees.；e.g. The dollar has fallen in value [[amid]] rumors of weakness in the US economy.

chinese: shine brightly with flashing points of light 闪烁；闪光
examples: e.g. Smoothed flat by generations of wind and rain, the stone [[glitters]] in the sun.

chinese: (usu. before noun) giving off many small flashes of light 闪光的；闪耀的
examples: e.g. The day ended with a cruise on the Huangpu River where we saw the [[glittering]] skyline of Shanghai.

chinese: [C] a person or organization who resists sth. or refuses to accept an offer 抵制者（或组织）；不合作者（或组织）
examples: e.g. A few [[holdouts]] still use typewriters, but nearly everybody uses computers now.

chinese: 1) make a copy of; imitate 复制；模仿
examples: e.g. Entrepreneurs have to move faster than ever to ensure others don't [[clone]] their ideas.；e.g. A team from the UK were the first to successfully [[clone]] an animal.

chinese: 2) make an exact copy of a plant or animal by taking a cell from it and developing it artificially 克隆
examples: e.g. Entrepreneurs have to move faster than ever to ensure others don't [[clone]] their ideas.；e.g. A team from the UK were the first to successfully [[clone]] an animal.

chinese: 1) [U] the introduction of new ideas or methods 革新；创新
examples: e.g. We must encourage [[innovation]] if the company is to remain competitive.；e.g. She believed she had come up with one of the greatest [[innovations]] of modern times.

chinese: 2) [C] a new idea, method, or invention 新观念；新方法；新发明
examples: e.g. We must encourage [[innovation]] if the company is to remain competitive.；e.g. She believed she had come up with one of the greatest [[innovations]] of modern times.

chinese: exist at the same time or in the same place 共存；共处
examples: e.g. Different traditions [[coexist]] successfully in this country.

chinese: more and more all the time 不断增加地；越来越多地
examples: e.g. [[Increasingly]], businesses are having to reduce their costs in order to survive.

chinese: 1) completely ready to do sth. or for sth. to happen, when it is likely to happen soon 准备好的；蓄势待发的
examples: e.g. The company is [[poised]] to launch its new advertising campaign.；e.g. Tina was tense, her hand [[poised]] over the telephone.

chinese: 2) not moving, but ready to move or do sth. at any moment （摆好姿势）准备行动的
examples: e.g. The company is [[poised]] to launch its new advertising campaign.；e.g. Tina was tense, her hand [[poised]] over the telephone.

chinese: not real or not made of natural things but made to be like sth. that is real or natural 人造的；人工的
examples: e.g. Energy is being wasted by using [[artificial]] lighting when daylight is adequate.

chinese: [U] (abbr. AI) the study of how to make computers do intelligent things that people can do, such as think and make decisions 人工智能
examples: e.g. Language is crucial to the development of [[artificial intelligence]].

chinese: [C] 无人机
examples: e.g. Above him an invisible plane [[droned]] through the night sky.

chinese: make a continuous low dull sound 发出持续的嗡嗡声；嗡嗡作响
examples: e.g. Above him an invisible plane [[droned]] through the night sky.

chinese: [C] sth. very lucky or very good that happens which you did not expect to happen or did not think was possible 意外的幸运事；不可思议的事；奇迹
examples: e.g. The economic [[miracle]] of this country has always been a mystery.

chinese: [U, sing.] sth. that encourages a process or activity to develop more quickly 刺激；推动（力）；促进
examples: e.g. The grant for building the opera house gave [[impetus]] to the city's cultural life.

chinese: (BrE also unrecognisable) sb. / sth. that is unrecognizable has changed or been damaged so much that you do not recognize them （变得）不能识别的，认不出来的
examples: e.g. I hadn't been to the city for 20 years and it was almost [[unrecognizable]].

chinese: 1) be very important or a powerful influence at a particular time 支配；盛行
examples: e.g. Silence [[reigned]] while we waited for news anxiously.；e.g. Queen Victoria [[reigned]] over Britain from 1837 to 1901.

chinese: 2) rule a nation or group of nations as their king, queen, or emperor 为王；为君
examples: e.g. Silence [[reigned]] while we waited for news anxiously.；e.g. Queen Victoria [[reigned]] over Britain from 1837 to 1901.

chinese: having the highest position of power, importance, or influence （权力、重要性或影响力）最高的，至高无上的
examples: e.g. Winning an Olympic gold medal was, I suppose, the [[supreme]] moment of my life.

chinese: [C] a part of an area of activity, esp. of business, trade, etc.（尤指商业、贸易等领域的）部门，行业
examples: e.g. Data is continuously transforming the current landscape of many industries, including the financial [[sector]].

chinese: [C] a small sign of sth. such as hope or understanding （希望等的）微弱迹象，一丝
examples: e.g. Despite an occasional [[glimmer]] of hope, this campaign has not produced any results.

chinese: succeed in doing sth., esp. after trying very hard（尤指通过努力）完成，实现
examples: e.g. If we all work together, I think we can [[accomplish]] our goal.

chinese: [C] sth. that is an impressive achievement, because it needs a lot of skill, strength, etc. to do 业绩；功绩；壮举
examples: e.g. The Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macao Bridge is a remarkable [[feat]] of engineering.

chinese: completely change the appearance, form, or character of sb. / sth., esp. in a way that improves it 使改观；使变形；使转化
examples: e.g. The place was [[transformed]] from a quiet farming village into a busy port.；e.g. The trip to the cinema [[transforms]] into a full-day activity for the family.

chinese: undergo a change in appearance, form, or character 改观；变形；转化
examples: e.g. The place was [[transformed]] from a quiet farming village into a busy port.；e.g. The trip to the cinema [[transforms]] into a full-day activity for the family.

chinese: [U] the ability to keep increasing, developing, or being more successful 动力；势头
examples: e.g. They are anxious to maintain the [[momentum]] of the search for a solution.

chinese: following one after another in a series without interruption 连续的；不间断的
examples: e.g. After six [[consecutive]] defeats, the team was almost ready to give up.

chinese: [C] the central and most important part of an area, system, activity, etc., which all the other parts are connected to （地域、系统、活动等的）中心，枢纽
examples: e.g. The city acts as the [[hub]] of the nation's railroads and highways.

chinese: 1) suddenly or surprisingly quickly 突然；一下子
examples: e.g. He's realistic enough to know he's not going to succeed [[overnight]].；e.g. The temperature could fall below zero [[overnight]] in late autumn.

chinese: 2) for or during the night 夜里；在夜间
examples: e.g. He's realistic enough to know he's not going to succeed [[overnight]].；e.g. The temperature could fall below zero [[overnight]] in late autumn.

chinese: in a way that people admire or respect 令人钦佩地
examples: e.g. The team played [[impressively]] throughout the game.

chinese: (fml.) grow or develop quickly 快速增长（发展）
examples: e.g. The company hoped to profit from the [[burgeoning]] market in artificial intelligence.

chinese: [C] an important new discovery in sth. you are studying, esp. one made after trying for a long time 突破；重大进展
examples: e.g. Chinese scientists have made a major [[breakthrough]] in chip manufacturing.

chinese: [U] the industry that designs and builds aircraft and space vehicles 航空航天工业；宇航工业
examples: e.g. Many companies are conducting ground-breaking research for the future of the [[aerospace]] industry.

chinese: very great; felt or experienced very strongly 巨大的；重大的；深远的；深切的
examples: e.g. Over time, habits and routines have a [[profound]] effect on our quality of life.

chinese: 1) develop and change gradually over a long period of time 逐步形成；逐渐演变
examples: e.g. Computer software will continue to [[evolve]] in response to users' needs.；e.g. More complex animals gradually [[evolved]] from these very simple creatures.

chinese: 2) (of plants, animals, etc.) change gradually over a long period of time（植物、动物等）进化，进化形成
examples: e.g. Computer software will continue to [[evolve]] in response to users' needs.；e.g. More complex animals gradually [[evolved]] from these very simple creatures.

chinese: imagine sth. that you think might happen in the future, esp. sth. that you think will be good 想象，展望（尤指美好的事）
examples: e.g. As a young teacher, I [[envisioned]] a future of educational excellence.

chinese: [U, sing.] an opinion that everyone in a group agrees with or accepts 共同意见；一致看法；共识
examples: e.g. Could we reach a [[consensus]] on this matter? Let's take a vote.

chinese: competing directly with another person or group 正面交锋地
examples: e.g. Rather than go [[head-to-head]] with their main rivals, they decided to try a more subtle approach.；e.g. He beat some of the world's greatest tennis players in [[head-to-head]] competition.

chinese: (only before noun) in which two people or groups face each other directly in order to decide the result of a disagreement or competition 正面交锋的
examples: e.g. Rather than go [[head-to-head]] with their main rivals, they decided to try a more subtle approach.；e.g. He beat some of the world's greatest tennis players in [[head-to-head]] competition.

chinese: [C] a position on a scale that shows how good sb. / sth. is when compared with others 排行；排名；名次
examples: e.g. Last year the tennis player rose from 39 to 35 in the world [[rankings]].

chinese: [sing.] all the people who work in a particular industry or company, or are available to work in a particular country or area （行业的）全体从业人员；（公司的）全体员工；（国家或地区的）劳动力
examples: e.g. Senior executives are looking to build a highly skilled [[workforce]].

chinese: (usu. before noun) showing determination; not giving up easily 顽强的；不屈不挠的；坚持不懈的
examples: e.g. Her ambition and [[dogged]] determination ensured that she rose to the top of her profession.

chinese: completely full of 充满···的
examples: e.g. This website is packed with expert advice on how to manage time.

chinese: at the present moment; for the time being 目前；暂时
examples: e.g. [[For now]], our plan will remain unchanged until something convinces us otherwise.

chinese: if sb. / sth. reigns supreme, they are the most important part of a situation or time 主宰；称雄；呈极盛之势
examples: e.g. At that time, the bicycle [[reigned supreme]] as Britain's most popular mode of transportation.

english: in the long / short / medium term
chinese: used to say what will happen or what happens generally over a long, short, or medium period of time 长期 / 短期 / 中期
examples: e.g. In the long term, alcohol causes high blood pressure.

chinese: (esp. spoken) used to say that you are not surprised by sth. 并不奇怪；不足为奇
examples: e.g. Under such circumstances, it is little wonder that they experience difficulties.

chinese: 硅谷（位于美国加利福尼亚州，因计算机和电子工业闻名）
(GII) 全球创新指数
(WIPO) 世界知识产权组织
(gross domestic product) 国内生产总值
